title: How the ‘Right to Repair’ Might Save Your Gadgets—and Save You Money
sub_head: New legislation aims to provide more options for fixing our broken gadgets. A journey to fix two MacBooks illustrates the repair restrictions put in place by Apple and other big tech companies.
body:
Name: MacBook Pro.
Date of birth: 2017.
Cause of death: Water. So. Much. Water.
Second chance: Replaced corroded parts on motherboard.
Just call me the Mother Teresa of laptops. I saved that MacBook Pro from being just another sad hunk of metal in the e-waste cemetery. OK, fine, a computer repairman saved it.
